name: Medgar and Myrlie Evers Home National Monument
description: Medgar and Myrlie Evers were partners in the civil rights struggle. The assassination of Medgar Evers in the carport of their home on June 12, 1963, was the first murder of a nationally significant leader of the American Civil Rights Movement, and it became a catalyst for passage of the Civil Rights Act of 1964. Myrlie Evers continues to promote issues of racial equality and social justice.
shortDescription: Medgar and Myrlie Evers were partners in the civil rights struggle. The assassination of Medgar Evers in the carport of their home on June 12, 1963, was the first murder of a nationally significant le...

operatingHours.description:
Our service hours are Tuesday-Saturday 9am-4pm, CLOSED from 12-1pm for lunch.

Grounds of the home are open sunrise to sunset every day. Please respect neighbors' privacy and private property.

climate.weatherDescription: Spring: Temperatures usually range from 50 F to 83 F. Rain is common. Summer: Be prepared for heat and humidity. Temperatures usually range from 70 F to 95 F. Thunderstorms are common. Fall: Temperatures usually range from 55 F to 79 F. Winter: Temperatures range from 40 F to 63 F. Rain is common.

images.title: Medgar and Myrlie Evers Home
images.altText: A small ranch-style home, aqua in color with light brown brick accents, sits on a shaded lot.
images.caption: Medgar and Myrlie Evers Home National Monument

images.title: Medgar Evers
